result.execSummary:
The defendant Corey J. Bellile was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).
  • Resisting or Obstructing an Officer. This is not a criminal offense and results only in a money penalty for this offense.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: No objection to release after 1 year if approved by Agent and successfully completes Probation.

miscConds.notes: Defendant to have no contact directly or indirectly with Susan Bellile unless authorized by Susan and Agent.
Defendant shall submit to any assessments and fully participate in any counseling deemed appropriate by the Agent and abide by any treatment recommendations.

C: Defendant, DOC

C: Defendant

Defendant Corey J. Bellile in court with attorney Joy N Sisler. 
John P Snider appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 
Plea Questionnaire / Waiver of Rights filed with the Court. 
Per DA Snider, amend Count 2 to City of Waupaca ordinance violation adopting 946.41 obstructing. 
Defendant enters no contest plea to Count 1 and amended Count 2. 
Victim statement filed with the Court and copy provided to Atty Sisler. 
Statements by DA Snider and Atty Sisler. 
Court orders sentence withheld, probation 2 years regarding Count 1, and $100 fine plus costs for total of $330.50 regarding amended Count 2. 
Probation conditions: 
- pay costs including DOMAB 
- pay restitution per summary and surcharge 
- submit to assessments/counseling and abide by recommendations 
- no contact directly/indirectly with Susan Bellile unless authorized by Susan and Agent 
- no objection to release from probation after 1 year if approved by Agent and successfully completes probation 
Defendant provided with appeal rights.
Status conference on December 13, 2016 at 09:30 am.
Status conference on October 31, 2016 at 02:00 pm.
